item.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds steady below $2,650 ahead of US PMI data - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Stable Below $2,650 Ahead of US PMI Data

Date & Source: January 2024, FXStreet

Introduction: The gold price (XAU/USD) remains stable around $2,650 in early Asian trading on Monday. Central bank demand and geopolitical tensions are expected to support gold prices, while upcoming US PMI data could influence market sentiment.

  1. Gold price holds steady near $2,650 in early Asian trading.
  2. Central bank buying and geopolitical risks in the Middle East support gold prices.
  3. Investors await US December PMI data for market direction.
  4. Trump's tariff plan could cap gold's upside due to inflation concerns.
  5. Fed meeting on Wednesday expected to cut interest rates by 25 basis points.
Significant demand from central banks lifts the yellow metal price. Central banks have been net buyers of gold for nearly 15 years, emphasizing its value as a crisis hedge and a reliable reserve asset.

Conclusion: Gold prices are likely to remain supported by central bank demand and geopolitical risks, but Trump's tariff plan and Fed policy will be key factors influencing its movement.

item.title: Bonus, Stock Split, Dividend Alert: Maruti Suzuki-backed company, Linc see corporate actions this week - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Bonus, Stock Split, Dividend Alert: Maruti Suzuki-backed company, Linc see corporate actions this week

Date: Not specified | Source: CNBC TV18

This week, several companies are set to undertake corporate actions, including stock splits and bonus issues, relevant to their shareholders. Notable actions include those from companies associated with Maruti Suzuki.

  • Bharat Seats: Announced a 1:1 bonus issue, record date is December 20.
  • Linc: Announced a bonus issue and a stock split (1 share of ₹10 into 2 shares of ₹5), record date is December 20.
  • Shish Industries: Will split one share of ₹10 into ten shares of ₹1; record date is December 17.
  • Styrenix Performance Materials: Declared an interim dividend of ₹31; record date is December 17.
  • Rajeshwari Cans: Announced a 1:1 bonus issue; record date is December 19.

item.title: In our sector, trust and credentials are key: Shriram Finance’s Venkatraman | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Shriram Finance's Venkatraman Discusses Trust and Digital Experiences

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

Recently, Shriram Finance Ltd launched a brand campaign featuring cricket legend Rahul Dravid, emphasizing trust and customer-centricity amidst a digital experience-driven market. Executive Director Elizabeth Venkatraman elaborates on the campaign’s strategy and brand priorities.

  • Focus on building consumer trust through engaging digital experiences.
  • Incorporation of sports metaphors to unify brand messaging.
  • Insights into the demands and expectations of Gen Z consumers.
  • The campaign aims to align with Shriram Finance's inclusive approach to marketing.
“In our sector, trust and credentials are key.” - Elizabeth Venkatraman

This campaign showcases Shriram Finance's commitment to meeting evolving customer expectations while enhancing its brand image.

item.title: Stock Under Rs 100: Multibagger smallcap stock delivers 3410% return in 5 yrs, Hong Kong-based FPI is new investor - ET Now
item.description:
Stock Under Rs 100: Multibagger smallcap stock delivers 3410% return in 5 yrs, Hong Kong-based FPI is new investor

Date: Updated Dec 15, 2024 | Source: ET Now

One Point One Solutions Limited has experienced a dramatic increase in share price over the past five years, with significant investment activities involving a Hong Kong-based foreign portfolio investor.

  • Shares have surged from Rs 2.88 to Rs 58, a 3410% return.
  • The company specializes in Business Management Services for sectors such as BFSI and E-commerce.
  • 17,85,714 equity shares were allotted to Ovata Equity Strategies Master Fund at Rs 56 per share.
"...we wish to inform you that the Board of Directors of the Company considered and approved the conversion of 17,85,714 convertible warrants into equity shares..."

This investment highlights the growing confidence in One Point One Solutions Limited as a potential multibagger in the smallcap space.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Status: Shares finalisation date, time - Check online by PAN, application number - ET Now
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Status: Shares finalisation date, time - Check online by PAN, application number

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: ET Now

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO was open for subscription from December 11 to December 13, 2024, with significant investor interest. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalized by December 16, 2024.

  • The IPO has a total issue size of Rs 8,000 crore and a price range of Rs 74-78 per share.
  • Vishal Mega Mart raised Rs 2,400 crore from anchor investors prior to the offering.
  • The IPO consists entirely of an offer-for-sale from promoter Kedaara Capital-led Samayat Services LLP, with no new equity being issued.

The IPO received 80.75 times subscription from Qualified Institutional Buyers, 14.25 times from non-institutional investors, and 2.31 times from Retail Individual Investors.

The IPO must be watched closely as its listing date on BSE and NSE is set for December 18, 2024, marking an important milestone for the company's public market entry.

item.title: MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates - News18
item.description:
MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

Date: December 15, 2024, Source: News18

The much-anticipated initial public offering (IPO) of MobiKwik has concluded with impressive subscription numbers, indicating strong market interest.

  • MobiKwik's unlisted shares are trading at Rs 444, a 59.14% rise from the upper price band of Rs 279.
  • The IPO opened for bidding from December 11-13 and was oversubscribed 125.69 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed 141.78 times, while institutional categories showed strong demand.
  • IPO allotment will be finalized on December 16 and listing is scheduled for December 18.
  • The public issue consists entirely of fresh equity shares worth Rs 572 crore.
"The IPO received an overwhelming 125.69 times subscription, showcasing significant interest from investors."

As MobiKwik prepares for its public market debut, it solidifies its position in India's fintech ecosystem.

item.title: New JV Announced! Dixon Technologies, Vivo India join hands to boost THIS business in India - ET Now
item.description:
Dixon Technologies and Vivo India Announce Joint Venture to Enhance Smartphone Manufacturing

Updated Dec 15, 2024, Source: ET Now

Dixon Technologies and Vivo India are forming a joint venture to enhance manufacturing capabilities in India. The partnership aims to support Vivo's OEM orders for smartphones and expand into other electronic products.

  • Dixon will hold a 51% stake in the joint venture.
  • Vivo India will possess the remaining 49% stake.
  • The JV will focus on OEM business for smartphones and other electronics.
"Dixon & vivo India enter into a Binding Term Sheet for a proposed joint venture to undertake OEM business of electronic devices, including smartphones," Dixon stated.

This joint venture marks a strategic partnership that leverages both companies' strengths, potentially reshaping manufacturing dynamics in India.

item.title: Stocks To Buy: Tata Motors, HDFC Bank, Paytm...among top 12 stock picks from Gaurang Shah for next 2-3 years - Full list - ET Now
item.description:
Stocks To Buy: Tata Motors, HDFC Bank, Paytm...among top 12 stock picks from Gaurang Shah for next 2-3 years - Full list

Updated Dec 15, 2024 from ET Now Digital

Ace market investor Gaurang Shah has shared his top 12 stock picks on ET NOW Swadesh that he believes will yield significant returns over the next 2-3 years.

  • Shah is bullish on Paytm, particularly after a significant Rs 2,364 crore transaction.
  • He sees potential in the automobile industry, including OEMs, tyre, and battery producers due to their interdependence.
  • Other recommended stocks include Tata Motors, HDFC Bank, and several banks in the financial sector.
  • He also anticipates modest growth in the FMCG sector and opportunities in the infrastructure and construction sectors.
"Shah believes the automobile industry, which includes OEMs, tyre and battery producers, would do well owing to their interdependence."

This analysis by Gaurang Shah provides investors insights into promising stocks for long-term investments across various sectors.

item.title: Trade set-up for Monday: Global cues, inflation data and FII flows top cues for stock markets next week - The Financial Express
item.description:
Trade Set-Up for Monday: Key Factors for Stock Markets Next Week

Publication Date: December 13, 2023 | Source: Financial Express

Indian stock markets are preparing for a significant week influenced by various global and domestic factors, including the US Federal Reserve's decisions and foreign institutional investments.

Key Points

  • FIIs have begun buying again after a period of selling, with total purchases reaching Rs 22,765 crores as of December 13.
  • Global trends and domestic inflation indicators are expected to shape market sentiments.
  • Concerns remain regarding potential foreign investment exits and impacts from rising crude oil prices.
  • Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation data release is anticipated to affect market stability.
  • The BSE benchmark rose 623.07 points, while Nifty gained 90.5 points last week.
“FIIs turning buyers in December after relentless selling in October and November has contributed to the recovery in the market from the November lows.” - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services

Investors are advised to stay alert for cues from both global and domestic indicators as uncertainties could affect market direction this week.

item.title: Reliance Industries, Bharat Forge, Biocon and more: Top stocks to watch out for on December 16 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top Stocks to Watch on December 16: Reliance Industries, Bharat Forge, Biocon and More

Publication Date: December 16

Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights the key stocks to observe in the market on December 16, detailing recent developments and acquisitions by major companies.

  • Reliance Industries: Acquired 74% stake in Navi Mumbai IIA for ₹1,628 crore.
  • Biocon: EMA recommended approval of biosimilar YESINTEK, expanding Biocon's footprint in Europe.
  • Aurobindo Pharma: Positive opinion received for biosimilar Zefylti.
  • Bharat Forge: Acquired 25% equity stake in Edgelab S.p.A for €2.5 million.
  • Lupin: Acquired three anti-diabetes trademarks from Boehringer Ingelheim.
  • Aeroflex Industries: Plans to raise ₹400 crore through a Qualified Institutional Placement.
  • Afcons Infrastructure: Secured a ₹1,007 crore metro rail project contract.
  • HBL Power Systems: Received an order worth ₹1,522.4 crore for Train Collision Avoidance Systems.
  • RITES: Bagged a ₹297.67 crore project for constructing an Integrated Check Post.
  • 63 Moons Technologies: Approved a one-time settlement of ₹1,950 crore proposed by NSEL Investors Forum.
“These developments indicate strong growth potential for the respective companies involved.”

The developments highlighted signify important market movements and opportunities for investors.
